question_text: During the electrolysis of copper (II) sulphate solution, an ammeter showed a steady current reading of 1.0A for 2hr and 6.6 x 104 kg of copper were liberated. Calculate the % error in ammeter reading?

question_text: Which of the following statements is correct about a temperature semi-conductor at room?
subject: Geography
options: The valence band is filled and the conduction band is partly filled
The valence band is completely filled and the conduction band is completely empty
The valence band is almost filled and the conduction band is almost empty
The valence band is empty and the conduction band is filled
correct_option: The valence band is almost filled and the conduction band is almost empty

question_text: Which of the following statements is not correct?
subject: Geography
options: When ebonite rod is rubbed with wool the ebonite rod acquires a negative charge and wool acquires a positive charge
When a glass rod is rubbed with silk the glass rod acquires a positive charge while silk acquires a negative charge
When fur is rubbed with ebonite rod the ebonite rod acquires a positive charge and fur a negative charge
When wool rubbed with an ebonite rod is brought near silk rubbed with a glass rod attraction occurs.
correct_option: When fur is rubbed with ebonite rod the ebonite rod acquires a positive charge and fur a negative charge

question_text: Which of the following arrangements gives the electromagnetic radiation in their ascending order of wavelength?
subject: Geography
options: Radio waves/ ultraviolet rays. x-rays. y- rays
y -rays. x-rays. ultraviolent rays. radio waves
x-rays. y -rays. radio waves. ultraviolent Rays
Ultraviolent rays. y -rays. x-rays. radio waves
correct_option: y -rays. x-rays. ultraviolent rays. radio waves

question_text: Which of the following statements is not correct about the astronomical telescope under normal adjustment?
subject: Geography
options: The final image is at infinity
The principal foci of the objective and eye piece coincide
The final image is at principal focus of the eye piece
The distance between the lenses is equal to the sum of their focal lengths
correct_option: The final image is at principal focus of the eye piece
